metadata.sermon_title: Easter VII: Faith Overcomes the World
metadata.notes: Preached at Grace Church, NYC, 1994. Context includes the aftermath of the Long Island Rail Road shooting.

freedom_from_critical_parent_CP.score_explanation: 10 = Completely free from coercive judgments. 0 = Very dominant Critical Parent.
freedom_from_critical_parent_CP.analysis: The preacher avoids 'must' and 'should' language, instead using personal confession to model behavior. There is a slight CP tone when critiquing 'cynical clergy' or 'successful people,' but it is directed at attitudes rather than the listener's personhood.
quotes: In this respect they are exactly the opposite of the cynical clergy I know
I think I was supposed to be flattered that she considered me to be among the successful.

healthy_care_NP.score_explanation: 10 = Healthy, non-smothering care. 0 = Absent or smothering.
healthy_care_NP.analysis: The Nurturing Parent is present through empathy for the grieving and the aging. It promotes autonomy by emphasizing that faith is a 'foundation' rather than a crutch that removes pain.
quotes: Because we are all part of one another here in that organic whole called the Body of Christ...

adult.analysis: The sermon is highly Adult-oriented. It processes objective data (news clippings, novels, theology) and engages in self-correction (the anecdote about the atheist friend). It invites the listener to observe reality as it is, including the reality of pain and death.
quotes: The more I think about it, however, the more I think I wasted an opportunity.
Now I am going to be very honest and tell you that I am not beyond being seduced...

freedom_from_adapted_child_AC.score_explanation: 10 = Free from fear/compliance. 0 = Strong Adapted Child (fear culture).
freedom_from_adapted_child_AC.analysis: The preacher does not speak from a place of needing to please a demanding God or a demanding congregation. He admits to his own 'vanity,' which is a Free Child move that bypasses the Adapted Child's need for a perfect mask.
quotes: I have found myself more than once in my life looking around a room to see who might be more interesting than whom.

free_child_FC.analysis: Authenticity is high, though the 'playful' element is subdued by the somber topics of cancer and murder. The FC appears in the honest admission of being 'interested in fashion.'
quotes: I am as interested in fashion as the next person...

transaction_analysis.analysis: The preacher speaks as one fellow-traveler to another. By sharing his own internal monologues and mistakes, he invites the congregation into a peer-level reflection rather than a top-down instruction.
transaction_analysis.ulterior_motives: Minimal. The preacher explicitly rejects the 'Bait & Switch' of using heaven to manipulate behavior.
transaction_analysis.risk_explanation: The only slight risk of an ulterior transaction is the 'conspiratorial' story about the successful couple, which could be seen as a subtle 'Parent -> Child' shaming of social ambition, but the preacher quickly crosses this by admitting he shares the same weakness.

detected_games.name: None
evidence_quotes: It has always seemed to me more than a little manipulative to dangle 'life after death' in front of people in order to convert them.

games_analysis.absence_of_games_analysis: The preacher explicitly deconstructs potential games like 'I'm Only Trying To Help You' (ITHY) by acknowledging that faith does not immediately remove 'wrenching pain.' He avoids 'Ain't It Awful' by moving from the tragedy of the shooting to the functional, active love of the parents.

preacher_roles.rescuer: Low. He refuses to offer 'simple solutions' or spiritual fads.
preacher_roles.persecutor: Low. He critiques 'the world' but includes himself in the critique.
preacher_roles.victim: Low. He admits vulnerability (fear of aging/seduction by success) but does not use it to solicit pity.

drama_triangle_analysis.congregation_position: The congregation is treated as a 'Body' of autonomous subjects who are 'God's work in progress,' rather than victims needing a hero.
drama_triangle_analysis.escape_possibilities: The sermon offers 'autonomy' through the definition of faith as a 'foundation' that allows one to face reality (death, failure) without being destroyed by it.

conclusion_and_recommendation.summary: This sermon is an exemplary model of psychologically healthy homiletics. It operates primarily from the Adult ego state, utilizing self-disclosure not as a performance, but as a means to level the playing field between pulpit and pew. By explicitly rejecting manipulative 'carrots' (dangling heaven to convert), the preacher avoids the 'Bait & Switch' game. The use of the Federici family story serves as a powerful Adult-Adult observation of reality rather than a sentimental Rescuer narrative. The preacher successfully navigates the tension between the 'now' and the 'not-yet' without falling into the 'Ain't It Awful' trap of collective passivity.
strengths: High level of transparency and Adult-Adult engagement.
Explicit rejection of manipulative conversion tactics.
Integration of the Free Child (honesty about fashion/success) to build trust.
areas_for_improvement: The critique of 'cynical clergy' borders on a Critical Parent 'NIGYSOB' moment.
The transition from the fashion industry to 'being scared' could be more clearly processed as an Adult observation rather than a Child fear.
conclusion_and_recommendation.advice_for_game_free_communication: Continue to use 'I' statements to model the struggle of faith. Ensure that when critiquing 'the world' (Versace, etc.), it remains an Adult analysis of values rather than a Critical Parent dismissal of people.
